snippet: Jamaica’s government on Thursday announced a major rethinking of its marijuana laws, including plans to partly decriminalize small amounts of marijuana and to allow possession for religious, scientific and medical purposes.
abstract: Jamaica's government announces major rethinking of its marijuana laws, including plans to partly decriminalize small amounts and to allow possession for religious, scientific and medical purposes.
lead_paragraph: Jamaica’s government on Thursday announced a major rethinking of its marijuana laws, including plans to partly decriminalize small amounts of marijuana and to allow possession for religious, scientific and medical purposes.

headline.main: Jamaica: Government Aims to Relax Marijuana Laws
headline.print_headline: Jamaica: Government Aims to Relax Marijuana Laws
